intro: Bunium capusii, commonly known as the Persian cumin or mountain cumin, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its seeds, which are small and aromatic, are often used in traditional medicine and cuisine. Bunium capusii thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun.
